intro: Oenothera claviformis subsp. cruciformis, commonly known as the cruciform evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its yellow, cruciform (cross-shaped) flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its nocturnal pollination by moths. The subspecies is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
